discourse_list.title: TUSD Offloading - Flat Kick Incentive Change

content.content: Protocol Engineering is informing the community that we will be setting the tip to 0 as part of the TUSD off-boarding. This has been done in order to prevent incentivised farming as described in MIP45. Anyone can participate (bark) in these auctions however there will not be any economic incentive to do so. In the event that these auctions are not called by the community, PECU will call these permissionlessly.
content.GPT-summary: Protocol Engineering is explaining that they will be setting the tip to 0 as part of the TUSD off-boarding to prevent incentivized farming. They also mention that anyone can participate in the auctions, but there will not be any economic incentive to do so. A 3rd party could give constructive criticism or audit/review the proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Note this refers to the Flat Kick Incentive (tip) parameter as part of the TUSD collateral offloading planned that will be included in the executive proposal later today.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
